result.execSummary:
The defendant Ramiro Fuentes Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any current supervision or sentence.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond in the amount of $500.00 to be applied to costs.  Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The denfendant is to have NO CONTACT with N. Trevino (victim as named in the complaint) without approval of the supervising agent.

DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.   Defendant to complete a Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 9:47 am case called. Defendant Ramiro Fuentes Hernandez in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant regarding SPD. Statement by DA Blader. Discussion between parties. 10:11 am case recalled. Same appearances. Agreement reached and stated on the record by Attorney Blader.   Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: No Contest to Count 2 & 3.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 1. Statement by victim to court. No statement by the defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places on probation for a period of 18 months. Concurrent to any current supervision or sentence.  CONDITIONS: DAAP & follow through, defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. NO CONTACT w/victim as named in the complaint without approval of supervising agent.  Costs to include the DNA surcharge to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Bond on file to be applied.  Appeal Rights Given.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is prohibited from leaving the State of Wisconsin.

RETURN ON WARRANT: Case called @ 1:13 p.m. Defendant Ramiro Fuentes Hernandez in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be not be represented by SPD if released from custody. ADA Anderson requesting $3000 Cash Bond. Statement by Atty Szilagyi regarding bond. Court orders $500 Cash Bond and $2500 Sig Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Prior: 11040 Sierra Ave, La Feria, TX 78559
Body Only with Extradition Within the Continental United States

Case Called @ 1:07 PM: Defendant Ramiro Fuentes Hernandez not in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  In light of nonappearance, Arrest Warrant authorized with Extradition Within the Continental U.S.
